string.name: app_name
string.description: The title of the application, Oculus Cinema, which let's you watch movies inside of Oculus

string.name: action_settings
string.description: The name of the settings menu.

string.name: title_activity_scrubber
string.description: The name of the scrubber activity. Never displayed.

string.name: Category_MyVideos
string.description: Category title for videos loaded by the user.

string.name: Category_LimeLight
string.description: Category title for LimeLight PCs to connect to.

string.name: Category_RemoteDesktop
string.description: Category title for RemoteDeskop PCs to connect to.

string.name: Category_VNC
string.description: Category title for VNC PCs to connect to.

string.name: MovieSelection_Resume
string.description: Resume movie icon text for movie selection carousel. Let's you resume a paused movie.

string.name: MovieSelection_Next
string.description: Text for next movie to be played icon for movie selection carousel.

string.name: ResumeMenu_Title
string.description: Title of menu for when app asks user if they want to resume watching the movie where they left off.

resources.string: What would you like to do?

string.name: ResumeMenu_Resume
string.description: Button for resume menu to resume the movie where they left off.

string.name: ResumeMenu_Restart
string.description: Button for resume menu to restart the movie from the beginning.

string.name: Error_NoVideosOnPhone
string.description: Error menu for when there are no videos found.

resources.string: To watch your videos in Oculus Cinema, record with your camera or copy videos to your phone

string.name: Error_NoVideosInMyVideos
string.description: Error menu for when there are no movies in the My Videos category.

resources.string: To watch your videos in Oculus Video, record with your camera or copy videos to your phone.

string.name: Error_UnableToPlayMovie
string.description: Error message for when a movie could not be played by the movie player.

string.name: MoviePlayer_Reorient
string.description: Text displayed when user looks away from the screen in the Void theater to indicate that they can reorient the screen by tapping the touchpad.

resources.string: Tap the touchpad to reorient screen
Computer is currently in a game. You must close the game before pairing.
Please enter the following PIN on the target PC:
Unable to wake PC because GFE didn\'t send a MAC address
It may take a few seconds for your PC to wake up. If it doesn\'t, make sure it\'s configured properly for Wake-On-LAN.
The ComputerManager service is not running. Please wait a few seconds or restart the app.
GFE returned an HTTP 404 error. Make sure your PC is running a supported GPU. Using remote desktop software can also cause this error. Try rebooting your machine or reinstalling GFE.
Moonlight has crashed due to a problem with this device\'s video decoder. Try adjusting the streaming settings if the crashes continue.
Your device\'s video decoder continues to crash at your selected streaming settings. Your streaming settings have been reset to default.
USB access is prohibited by your device administrator. Check your Knox or MDM settings.
Warning: Your active network connection is metered!
Searching for PCs with GameStream running…\n\n Ensure GameStream is enabled in the GeForce Experience SHIELD settings.
Are you sure you want to quit the running app? All unsaved data will be lost.
Unable to connect to the specified computer. Make sure the required ports are allowed through the firewall.
Unable to resolve PC address. Make sure you didn\'t make a typo in the address.
You must enter an IP address
That address doesn\'t look right. You must use your router\'s public IP address for streaming over the Internet.
Setting values too high for your device may cause lag or crashing
Lower bitrate to reduce stuttering. Raise bitrate to increase image quality.
Disable on-screen connection warning messages while streaming
Uses less battery, but may increase stuttering
Allows the stream to be viewed (but not controlled) while multitasking
Uncheck if you experience audio issues. Requires GFE 2.7 or higher.
When unchecked, all controllers appear as one
Enables a built-in USB driver for devices without native Xbox controller support
Forces Moonlight\'s USB driver to take over all supported Xbox gamepads
Long pressing the Start button will switch the gamepad into mouse mode
Show virtual controller overlay on touchscreen
Hide all virtual buttons except L3 and R3
Resets all on-screen controls to their default size and position
Are you sure you want to delete your saved on-screen controls layout?
Display apps and PCs in lists instead of grids
Use small icons in grid items to allow more items on screen
Allow GFE to modify game settings for optimal streaming
Play audio from the computer and this device
May reduce micro-stuttering on some devices, but can increase latency
H.265 lowers video bandwidth requirements but requires a very recent device
Stream HDR when the game and PC GPU support it. HDR requires a GTX 1000 series GPU or later.
